Úgy vélem, hogy bármiféle túlzás nélkül az Artifex Mundi-t tekinthetjük napjaink legtermékenyebb point n' click csapatának, ugyanis egyik minőségi címet a másik után dobálgatják ki a piacra, miközben tökéletesen konzisztensen tartanak egy olyan bemutatott és alkalmanként fejlesztgetett összszínvonalat, melyhez az alkalmi érdeklődőből lelkes rajongóvá avanzsált játékosok mindig élvezettel térnek vissza. 
Ha szereted a nyugodt hangulatú többnyire fantasy vagy épp tündérmeséket idéző helyszíneken játszódó történeteket akkor ezek a játékok a Te világod. Minden egyes címüknek a kezelőfelülete úgy van felépítve, hogy még egy potenciális elakadás esetén se kelljen a játékosnak begörcsölnie a játékmenettől hanem az egész élmény egy lebilincselően relaxáló alkalmi feladványokkal tüzdelt kellemes kikapcsolódást nyújtson. 
Ők nem akarják minden egyes címükkel megváltani a világot, hanem csak szimplán tisztában vannak a saját erősségeikkel és ezt kamatoztatják újra és újra minden egyes játék elkészítésekor.

Csak így tovább, AM, már be is csaptam magamnak a kövi kipróbálandó játékotokat a könyvtáramba. :D

36245895.review: L'histoire est celle d'une guérisseuse qui arrive dans un château pour tenter de rendre la parole à une reine muette. Tout se passe pas trop mal jusqu'à ce que ... Voila pour un topo de base sans spoiler! Après, ça deviens difficile d'en parler sans raconter l'un des rares rebondissements. Pourtant, la force du jeu n'est pas la. Elle est dans les décors, dans les SOC, dans la beauté des images, ... Cette sorte de douceur féerique est partout pendant une très grosse partie du jeu, ce qui en fait un très bel endroit de "balade" en rerun. Dans ce jeu aussi, on utilise les "compagnons", selon les environnements. L'histoire, si elle est "simpliste" n'en est pas pour le moins jolie, émouvante ... Pas de gros problèmes avec les énigmes, sauf celle des perles, et pas de problèmes de traduction.  Pour un jeu d'objet caché, ça manque un peu de SOC.  Très beau jeu et beau coup de cœur pour moi.

This is one of the best reasons to get into HOPA. Stunning graphics coupled with an intriguing, if not too original, story makes it an ease and a blast to play. Though it's perhaps a bit light on hidden object scenes and more towards the fragmented object-type what is there is generally challenging without becoming tedious. The puzzles are also great with decent variety and some properly challenging ones that will force you to think rather than brute force your way through it. Bit lacking in the extras, would've especially liked to get the soundtrack since it was beautiful but that's just bonus stuff.

Artifex Mundi can definitely be uneven with the quality of the games they publish but this is definitely one of their best. If you're at all curious about HOPA or you need another fix, this is definitely one to get.

31748918.review:
[h1]Temná pohádka[/h1]
Druhý díl Grim Legends je temný. Na rozdíl od většiny HOG her zde uvidíte umírat lidi a tento fakt přidává dost na atmosféře. Když si k tomu přičtete i lehce upravený příběh o sedmi labutích spojený s černou magií a úžasnou grafickou stylizací, dostanete adepta na jednu z nej her v tomto žánru.

Příběh je místy předvídatelný a pokud znáte tuto pohádku, už dopředu tak nějak tušíte, jak to dopadne. Ani ono obrovské odhalení na konci hry pro mě nebylo překvapivé. Postavy jsou zajímavé a především mi bylo líto bělovlasé němé krásky, kterou čeká poprava, protože holduje zakázané černé magii. Kdo jediný ji může zachránit, než vy? A kdo jediný může kromě toho také najít její ztracené dítě? Tentokrát však neleží osud nebohé ženy jen na vašich bedrech, ale postupem hrou získáváte různé spojence. Ptáček, vydra nebo lesní duch (ne, nemyslím toho z Evil Dead...), vše je zakomponováno perfektně. Místy mi sice vadilo, že oněch nadpřirozených prvků je až příliš moc, na druhou stranu je to však spíše osobní výtka, která se neodráží na výsledném hodnocení.

[h1]Audiovizuální zpracování a hratelnost[/h1]
Hudba je hodně nadprůměrná, pár melodií mi zůstalo v hlavě a dokonce jsem kvůli nim i chvíli počkal ve hře, abych je slyšel co nejdéle. Vizuální kabátek tohoto titulu se mi zpočátku zas tak moc nelíbil, ale po pár minutách si zvyknete a tenhle osobitý styl se mi opravdu zamlouvá. Přidává dost k té pohádkovosti celého GL2.

Co se týče hádanek, byly jedním slovem parádní. Několik originálních kousků tu najdete, drtivou většinu ale znáte již z ostatních HOG her. Jenže i ty hádanky jsou překrásné a ta stylizace je něco, co je vyzdvihuje do nebes.

[h1]Doplňkové dobrodružství[/h1]
Bohužel ne vše je skvělé. Když se vám představí lesní duch v základní hře, je roztomilý a jelikož je s vámi jen krátce, nijak vám nevadí. Jenže poté se vám zpřístupní i doplňkové dobrodružství a to je prostě nuda. V první polovině osvobozujete tyhle malé potvůrky (které už jsou otravné a ne roztomilé) ze spárů draka, v druhé půlce se jej poté snažíte nadobro zbavit. Chudák drak.

[h1]Plusy[/h1]
+ příběh je i přes jistou míru předvídatelnosti hodně zajímavý
+ hra je temnější a dospělejší
+ naprosto perfektní grafická stylizace (taková pohádková)
+ kvalitní hudba
+ parádní hádanky, které jsou vyvedeny perfektně i po grafické stránce

[h1]Mínusy[/h1]
- doplňkové dobrodružství je nudné
- pokud znáte pohádku, očekávejte předvídatelný příběh

[h1]Konečný verdikt[/h1]
[b]Mé hodnocení: 9/10[/b]

Temnější pohádka s překrásnou stylizací, zajímavým dějem a parádními hádankami. Rozhodně nejlepší dílo z celé trilogie Grim Legends a bezesporu i jeden z nepovedenějších titulů HOG žánru. Rozhodně kupujte.

30973577.review:
Much better than the first game, but still not up to my expectations when Mundi's name is on it.  While there are a few good HOGs in this title, they are few and far between.  Most of them are single-item hunts (e.g. find only feathers) which are far less enjoyable than the "find random crap on the screen" style puzzles, but admittedly that's just personal preference, and those ones do make an appearance albeit sparsely.

The story is nonsense, but I don't really think anyone plays these games for the story.  Suffice to say that doesn't have the standard "horror" element to it, so those who are typically put off by Mundi's cheap startle-scare thrills (always fun) will have nothing to worry about here.  Still, there's some stuff here that might give some kids nightmares (a little off-screen violence and the overall dark tone of the story) and some that might give adults nightmares (Mundi tradition of creepy animated children who talk funny).

On the plus side, it's a solid romp and none too difficult on expert difficulty, though you may find yourself stuck at times (protip: there's probably a HOG that has appeared on a previous room).  The extra hidden sigil quest is pretty easy this time around as you are notified when one is in the room you're in.  Also, there's no need to contend with mind-numbing alternatives to the HOGs (like mahjong when you suck at finding stuff) and therefore no need to play through the game again just to get them achievements.  Unfortunately, for those who -do- enjoy those minigames instead of solving the HOGs, you're out of luck here.

29318811.review:
[h1]Don't get your hopes high and you'll be ok[/h1]

Another HOG! I'd be lying if I said I didn't enjoy this one - [i]for the most part[/i]. 

[b]Story[/b] started out pretty interesting. There's a mystery to be solved and it involves a fair bit of drama. I enjoyed the narrative and where things were going... until the end. The conclusion - as with many other HOGs - was abrupt, rushed, stupid and illogical.

[b]Graphics[/b] are lovely. Touches of animation on each screen make the environments come alive, coupled with nice ambient sound/music.

[b]Music[/b] is pleasant and appropriate for each setting.

[b]Animation[/b] is very average and nothing to shout about, but will not take away from your enjoyment of the game. There are nicely done cutscenes every now and then as the story advances and you can play them back at any time from the main menu.

[b]Puzzles[/b] are mostly very easy, but contain a few of your standard slider types which were truly irritating. I didn't skip them because I am OCD about completing every puzzle I come across without any help, but wish I had because they are a real waste of time.

[b]Bonus content[/b] becomes available after you complete the game. The story is unrelated to the main game but complements it. It was pretty enjoyable with some good adventure puzzles.

[b]HOG component[/b] comprises finding fragmented objects mostly, though there are maybe 1 or 2 scenes that require finding whole ones. They're fairly easy and were quite fun because after assembling an object, you are required to use it in the scene itself.

[h1]Summary[/h1]
Aside from a weak ending, this was a lot more fun and interesting (story-wise) compared to many other HOGs. The narrative is compelling.

29293076.review:
Naszą główną bohaterką jest uzdrowicielka, która została wezwana do pewnego królestwa, aby pomóc jego królowej odzyskać głos. W samym królestwie obowiązuje całkowity zakaz używania magii, a nasza klientka nie dość, że nie mówi, to jeszcze zachowuje się podejrzanie.

Jeżeli ktoś z grubsza kojarzy baśń o braciach zaklętych w łabędzie, to dość szybko połapie się przynajmniej w części fabuły.
Zresztą abstrahując od samej adaptacji wspomnianej baśni, gra mało subtelnie pokazuje, do czego będzie nawiązywać. Ponadto sam tytuł jest trochę bez sensu. Dwójka oznacza sequel poprzednich Grim Legends, a tak naprawdę nie ma do nich ani jednego nawiązania. Więc dopóki nie wyjdzie część trzecia wiążąca poprzedniczki w większą całość, można je rozgrywać w dowolnej kolejności i nic na tym nie stracić. Dodatkowo bonusowa miniprzygoda nie jest wcale powiązana z głównym wątkiem.

W pierwszej części zachwycałem się przepiękną oprawą graficzną. Dwójka jakościowo jest jeszcze lepsza, choć tak naprawdę podobała mi się mniej. Może dlatego, iż dominującym (a przynajmniej ja miałem takie wrażenie) kolorem był tutaj zielony.
Pomimo tego, iż sama drobiazgowość w projektowaniu kolejnych ekranów gry została utrzymana, niektóre z miejsc oraz zbliżeń są mniej czytelne od tych z oryginału. Zarówno w przypadku łamigłówek, jak i zwykłej eksploracji sprowadza się to do tego, iż łatwo przeoczyć kluczowe przedmioty, a potem ganiać bez sensu w tę i nazad, bo coś nam umknęło.

Sytuacja z łamigłówkami przypomina inne serie tego wydawnictwa. Wiele z nich stanowi kalkę oryginału i jakoś tak brak  im polotu. Patent z wykorzystaniem chowańca powtórzono i niby urozmaicono, a w rezultacie niepotrzebnie przeciągnięto. Eksploracja w porównaniu do oryginału została mocno ograniczona. Zamiast jednego dużego obszaru mamy kilka mniejszych. W związku z czym jeśli pominiecie jakieś znajdźki i przejdziecie dalej – nie ma możliwości powrotu.

Podsumowując, w GL2 grało się dobrze, ale w porównaniu do poprzedniczki wypada ona słabiej. W związku z czym ode mnie: 3+, a jeśli GL3 nijak nie stworzy jednolitej serii, dwójkę można sobie darować.

http://kresowyblog.blogspot.com/2016/04/grim-legends-2-song-of-dark-swan.html

I bought Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan in a Bundle a while ago and I don't regret it. 

Before we Start the Review let me say that you don't have to play the first one as both of the stories are not related somehow and the main character seems to be different as well.

Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan is an amazing Point & Click / HO Game made by inhouse Artifex Mundi, the Artwork is great and the atmosphere amazing as always! However in this Title some of the Voice Actors where actually a bit awful to listen to.

This Game also comes with the Collectors Edition although it does not say so on Steam.

The Puzzles were mostly okay, challenging but not impossible. A few of the Puzzles however were absolutley stupidly difficult and I could not get passed them. But if you are good in Math you might find this hurd rather less annoying.

Although I had my difficutlies with this Game I still love its Story and its vibrant colourful Art Style.

I do recommend this game to people that are good in math or like mathmatic Puzzles. I also recommend this people to Achievement Hunters and to people that like HO / Point & Click Games.

28277679.review:
[h1]Artistic freedom in a Fairy Tale[/h1]

Type of Game: Hidden Object Game/Casual Adventure

Review in short: A good Hidden Object game, with a sympathetic story. A must buy for Fans of Fairy Tales, and Hidden Object afficinados.

Rating: 7.5 out of 10.

The story is a freeform of the Grimm Fairy Tale "The six swans". But instead of keeping too close to the story, which is quite familiar and actually exists in different versions (The twelve brothers, the seven ravens etc) it also uses freedom from the original, making it very interesting.

Artifex Mundi actually managed to catch the charm and the enchantment of the old fairy tale. The game is for younger people, and it's also aimed to a younger female audience. The game mechanics are, as with Hidden Object Games common easy to explain, and the tutorial could be easily put aside. The graphics are, again - as most of the time with Artifex Mundi - beautiful and enchanting. The riddles aren't always logical and more on a medium challenge level, yet they are perfectly integrated into the game and the story. The soundtrack also creates a good atmosphere. 

Recommendation: For Fans of Fairy Tales, Hidden-Object-Game, for younger audiences. 

[h1]Recommended[/h1]

Given the presentation and the game in general, it's a nice game to play - albeit it's short (all HOGs are short) it's worth the time invested into it.

26265259.review:
这里简单说下Grim Legends: Song of the Dark Swan和Grim Legends: The Forsaken Bride这两部作品。
自己算是Artifex Mundi公司的粉丝了。基本上win10和window phone上的此公司游戏都本人的必买游戏。在安卓和苹果商店这个公司的游戏价格都不菲，相对便宜的是window商店和steam。Grim Legends即恐怖传说这个系列如今出了两作，这两部作品间隔时间不短。这个系列是按照暗黑童话来改编的，基本算是借用童话元素改编的偏黑暗风格的故事。第一部The Forsaken Bride在取材和立意上比此作Song of the Dark Swan要逊色一些，但在故事的结局及主线故事后的隐藏故事等内容上，The Forsaken Bride要更好一些。这是我本人在不剧透且玩过这两部作品后的直观感受。
本作Song of the Dark Swan的小游戏部分并不简单，相对于AM公司的其他作品本作在小游戏上的难度也算排得上号的。因此喜欢挑战的玩家对于本作肯定不会失望。最后要说的是，虽然Grim Legends两作都有些瑕疵，但在故事的设计及完整性上都属于上乘，绝没有AM公司一些其他作品那种虎头蛇尾的感觉（这里就不剧透那些AM公司出的不如人意的作品名称了）。此外Grim Legends两作作品故事相对独立，即便只购买游玩一个，也不会对另一个造成影响。本人还是很推荐的。

25855118.review:
This is Artifex Mundi at their absolute most glorious. Lovers of lesser-known fairy tales will recognize the homage to "The Wild Swans" as the base of this, albeit with a chillingly dark turn. The villain is a bit predictable, but that's easy to forgive with all the effort, love and breathtaking artistry on display. The art style especially - for both the surroundings and the hidden object scenes is breathtaking. In former titles, character animation was a bit lackluster, but they really put all their heartsblood into it this time. Another plus: here is less confusing backtracking than with Artifex Mundi's other titles (that tended to drag them down) The mechanic of letting forest animals help you on your journey is a delight. Special mention also for the music, which is beautiful, calming and really puts you into a fairy tale mindset.

Bravo, Artifex Mundi. Bravo, bravo, bravo. You show us how HOGs are done. For any fan of HOGs, this is an absolute must. And if you're new to HOGs, this is a shining diamond of the genre.

[h1] Information [/h1]

Grim Legends 2: Das Lied des dunklen Schwans ist ein Wimmelbild - Adventure das viele phantasievolle Schauplätze und Aufgaben bietet.

[h1] Gameplay [/h1]

Als die Königin des Adlerkönigreiches von einer mysteriösen Krankheit befallen wird, wirst du als eine berühmte Heilerin zum Schloss gerufen, um dieses zu untersuchen. Dein Auftrag nimmt eine plötzliche und drastische Wendung, als der kleine Prinz unter mysteriösen Umständen verschwindet. Die Königin wird beschuldigt, dunkle Magie zu praktizieren, und in den Gefängnisturm geworfen. Der verzweifelte König, der an die Unschuld seiner Frau glaubt, fleht dich an, eine Möglichkeit zu finden, um die Königin zu entlasten. Wird es dir gelingen, die Königin zu retten und kannst du den kleinen Prinzen aus den Fängen der dunklen Magie retten? Dein Abenteuer beginnt. Viele phantasievolle Schauplätze, an denen Aufgaben zu erledigen sind. 

[h1] Pro [/h1]

+ schöne Grafiken
+ guter  Soundtrack
+ Mini-Spiele spielen sich angenehm
+ Hinweis-System
+ Schnellreise per Karte verfügbar
+ Errungenschaften und Trading Cards

[h1] Kontra [/h1]

- Geschichte kann nicht ganz überzeugen 
- Rätsel und Wimmelbilder sind einfach gehalten

[h1] Fazit  [/h1]

Das Märchen „Die sechs Schwäne“, an das sich diese faszinierende Geschichte anlehnt, ist hinlänglich bekannt, die Umsetzung sehr gut gemacht, dieses besteht aus einer schönen Grafik, einem Märchen-Ambiente und hübschen Effekte.

25390130.review:
Although this is the second [i]Grim Legends[/i] game, the story is not a sequel to [i]Grim Legends: The Forsaken Bride[/i] and can stand alone. The story is a retelling of a fairy tale with many variants where a sister must rescue her brothers from swan form by making shirts of nettles. Since I'm a sucker for fairy tale retellings, this automatically gave it plenty of credit in my eyes despite the overly expository intro.

As far as game mechanics are concerned, I really liked that they had a bottle that glowed if you hadn't found the collectible on that screen yet. I only wish that was a feature they had continued using in successive games. Instead of just one animal helper like in the first game, you had three helpers depending on location who make a noise to indicate when there's a task they can help with.

The music wasn't quite as good as the first game, but I did like how they used feathers instead of just sparkling to indicate hidden object scenes. Little details like that can really make a game.

There are several cute and unique minor characters that are surprisingly well-developed for such a short game. Some of these characters make appearances in both the main adventure as well as in the prequel bonus adventure.

Despite a couple of inevitable idiosyncratic moments, this is a quality hidden object puzzle adventure game that is well worth adding to your inventory.

25354933.review:
The production quality is excellent as customary for Artifex Mundi, but I simply can't recommend this game.

[h1]The good:[/h1]

+ Nice graphics (though the facial animations are weird)
+ Most HO scenes are especially beautiful, and look very congruent, not pieced together
+ Superb music and sound design
+ The genre's classic gameplay mechanics and controls
+ When carrying the baby, it appears on the bottom of the screen, adding realism

[h1]The bad:[/h1]

- This is the case where being bound by an original fairytale bites the game on the ankle, because this game has both the most confusing plot and the most over-swollen cast of characters of pretty much any HOPA game I've ever played.

I simply couldn't follow who is who, who did what, how are the 10? (or even more? I couldn't even figure out their full numbers) members of cast are related to each other. Many of them look very similar to each other, and barely 2 of them shows any notable personality.

- The children's voice acting was horrible.
- There were way too many companions. (This too might be due to the restriction imposed by the original plot, which the writers couldn't find a better workaround for.)
- The bonus story is weird and silly

[h1]Verdict:[/h1]
If you don't care about the plot at all, go for it, it looks/sounds pretty, and you probably know what to expect from an Artifex Mundi game in terms of gameplay.

On the other hand if you want to at least [i]understand[/i] what's going on, I'd say avoid this game, and pick another one from Artifex Mundi, say, [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/284850/]Grim Legends: The Forsaken Bride[/url] or [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/259740/]Nightmares from the Deep: The Cursed Heart[/url].

La verdad es que este juego no es 100% redondo en su mecanica a la hora de interactuar con algunos objetos pero funciona bastante bien. Su historia esta bastante mejor contada que el anterior e incluso esta mucho más nutrida de variedad y de elementos que la hacen más llamativa e interesante pero podría estar un poco mejor en alguna que otra parte. 

Pros:

-Diseños geniales y variados que nos muestran castillos, bosques y lagos tipicos de una historia de fantasia.
-Una buena historia. Bastante mejor armada que su anterior y que si bien tiene esos típicos elementos de la fantasia no empelada (no a mi por lo menos).
-Una buena ambientación. Tanto su banda sonora, como sus entornos, voces y sonidos cumplen bastante bien su función dentro de todo el juego.
-Un nivel de dificultad bastante interesante. Yo fui directamente por la más dificil pero vi que tiene 3 dificultades diferentes.
-Una durabilidad más que aceptable. No se esactamente cuanto me llevo terminarlo pero en las casi 11 horas que sumo termine 2 veces la historia principal y una vez la historia extra.
-Un buen puñado de logros.

Contras:
-Errores de traduccion. Algunos de estos llevan un poco a la confusión a la hora de hacer busquedas y otros confunden un poco al seguir el hilo de la historia.

En resumen Song of the Dark Swan tiene una historia interesante, buenos diseños y una buena dificultad... Podría no tener esos pocos errores de traducción pero en su totalidad esta todo bastante bien.

24215847.review:
If you're a fan of this genre, you'll probably like it. Its quality is definitely above average. I also recommend it for people below school age...

This is my 3rd try at HOG games.. coz I got loads of them from a bundle. I know part of the reason for its high ratings is most of the reviewers already like HOG---that's why they bought it---but I couldn't resist the consistency of ratings. Almost all Artifex Mundi games are well received, so I wanted to really see for myself before saying 'no'.

Turns out that was a mistake.. I don't hate it, but I just cannot recommend this to people like me. I feel there is just much better games out there. IMO most other games genres are more fun than the HOG genre... but of course I don't force my opinion on HOG fans.

I don't hate what defines a HOG.. the hidden objects scenes.. but it's not fulfilling either. I don't feel much out of it except for time wasted. If I just want to kill time, I go for arcade games. If I want something relaxing and also kill time, I'll play some zen games like Mountain.. or Minecraft, heck Minecraft is suitable for so many occasions and it's perfect for wasting time.

IMO this game is overall better than the first installment in this series. It feels more polished and smooth and finding sigils is less annoying than finding the story parts in the Forsaken Bride. I still disagree with a lot of design decisions in this game though, mainly about when players should be allowed to find something---finding objects before plot appears messes up the story and makes the game more 'trial & error" and aimless.

The storytelling is satisfactory for a HOG, which are known for bad stories. It is praiseworthy that it's somewhat engaging (much better at it than the first one) despite being a well known Grimm's tale, thanks to the twists and turns, and all those clues and details that fill in the story and make for an immersive experience. But the ending is so ridiculous.. it makes me uncomfortable. [spoiler]A guy does not show the least bit of sadness for his just deceased mom, and smiles like nothing happened-.-[/spoiler]

I also applaud the original puzzles. Some of them I've never seen in other games, like [spoiler]the "untangling fishnet" one[/spoiler]. But it's not enough for me to stop regretting buying it.

I hate the voiceover. It's so emotionless and children's books like.. Indeed am I the only adult playing this game? I just felt awkward for writing so long lol. Maybe the target audience is children in the first place..

At the very least, I think HOG is good for learning English words for a bunch of useless stuff.. :/

23622278.review:
[i]Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan[/i] is the second installment in the [i]Grim Legends[/i] game series, it has no connection to the first title however. In this game you play a world famous healer brought to the Eagle Kingdom to tend to the beautiful queen. What starts off as a simple visit turns into an epic adventure battling dark magic and an evil curse. The fate of two kingdoms -and the lives of their denizens- lay in your hands. This game is filled with interesting twists and turns as well great gameplay, making a very enjoyable experience for fans of hidden object games.

You take the role of the famous healer brought to a majestic castle, you begin your job tending to the queen and everything is going well until the young prince is kidnapped and the queen is accused of practicing black magic. This offense is punishable by death and she is taken to jail. Her king is distraught and tasks you with the job of proving her innocence. Soon you’re dragged into a world of magic, curses and death as you race to find the prince and save his mother. Despite the title mentioning a “dark swan” this doesn’t play too big of a role in the story, mainly confined to the first half, which I found disappointing. The story is also rather predictable and not very interesting. I found the story of the Swan Kingdom, where the queen is from, to be the most alluring. It’s told via flashbacks and explains why the kingdom fell under a curse.

To play the game you use your mouse to interact with people and objects as well as move around. You also collect useful items and tools that you need to progress in the game.The main crux of the game are hidden object scenes where you are given a written list of items to find in the scene. There also some scenes where the list is presented as pictures of items to find. I felt that the game could have used more hidden object scenes, I also felt that the scenes could have been a bit more complex- such as requiring you to perform a few different steps to find an item, like move a piece of paper aside or paint a feather red. There are also puzzles in the game, they’re not too difficult but some do offer a challenge. One note, you play a healer in the game so I expected potion-making to be a larger part of the gameplay. While it did factor in more than usual hidden object titles I felt it was under-utilized.

Graphics-wise the game is beautiful. Lovely colors and artwork help keep the feel of the fairy tale land you’re exploring. The hidden object scenes are very well done with the items not being too small that it would hurt your eyes. The character models are very well done though movements can be a bit stiff. The game has full voice acting which is well done, though some of the younger characters can sound a bit annoying and their acting is off, but this is a minor issue. Music in the game is lovely and fits the tone of the story and all of the sound effects are also spot on.

Overall I do recommend [i]Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan[/i] as an addition to your library. While not as stand out as the first title in the series, it’s still a solid gaming experience. There are Steam cards and achievements as well as collectable items to find during your playthrough. There is also a bonus chapter which is very adorable and also gives a nice side story about the queen. You have three cute sidekicks to help on your adventure which adds a bit of levity to the story, however, I did find the ending anticlimactic. All complaints aside, this is a good game, it’s fun to play and I recommend grabbing it when you can.

[url=http://lunarproductions.tumblr.com/]Lunar Productions[/url]

23452969.review:
Grim Legends 2: Song og the Dark Swan is much like the first one a cute point and click adventure game. And I will recommend them for anyone that want to experience the old kind of folk narratives, as that is what the story reminds me of the most. (Fairy Tales, Moral stories, legends.) While the game plays and feel mostly the same, I think it is an improvement from the first one.

The game is in first person, but unlike the first game it doesn't really bother me so much here. Since the protagonist is known as the "healer" and doesn't have a preexisting relationship with any of the characters, so while her profession is given she is pretty much a blank slate. (Personally still prefer most games in third person, but unlike the first game, I think the first person works here.)

The story is easy to follow and the puzzles are mostly enjoyable. This time the story fits the slower puzzle solving gameplay better than the first one, as the threats to the characters aren't presented to be as immediate as they were in the first game. So it makes sense that you work slowly to uncover the story. It is more the: “We need this done as soon as possible!” As opposed to some moments of the first one: “We need to do this NOW or we will die!”

The characters are easily identifiable and not very complex, but that fits well with the genre of story that is told in the game. As it is more about telling an enchanting tale, rather than how the characters experience the events. So you will be most likely able to guess who the evil one is before it is revealed just from clichés in old stories, but the story is still cute and charming. I won’t replay it, but I don’t regret buying or playing it.

22799473.review:
[h1] Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan (어두운 전설 2 : 검은백조의 노래)[/h1]

이 게임에 대해서 몇자 적어본다.
게임의 모티브가 되는 건 안데르센의 동화 '백조왕자(The Wild Swans)'이다. 기본 컨셉이 거의 같다.
오빠들이 저주에 걸려서 백조가 된다거나 말을 못하는 왕비(공주) 등은 안데르센 동화 백조왕자의 컨셉을 그대로 가져왔다.
다만, 주인공은 제 3자인 여치료사라고 할수 있다.

여타 히든 오브젝트게임과 비슷하게 숨은그림찾기와 미니게임으로 게임을 진행하는 방식이고
스토리는 다소 평이한 수준이지만,
그래픽이나 게임 중간 중간에 나오는 동영상 등의 연출이 상당히 뛰어나고
역시 히든 오브젝트게임 회사 중에선 Artifex Mundi사가 독보적이라는걸 새삼 또 느끼게 하는 게임이다.
히든 오브젝트게임 제작사 중에선 Artifex Mundi사의 게임이 제일 뛰어나다.

한번 플레이하는데 4시간 정도 소요되는데 정말 재밌게 플레이했고,
짧게 몇시간 즐기기에 좋은 게임이다.
도전과제도 다른 게임에 비하면 달성하기 쉬운편이다.
많은 사람들이 생각하는것이 대동소이하든걸 새삼 느끼게 되는 것이 본인이 플레이해본 결과 게임이 괜찮아서 90점을 줘도 되겠다고 생각했었는데, 역시나 대부분의 유저들이 좋은 평가를 내렸고  전체적인 평점도 상당히 좋은 편이다.
해외에는 벌써 3탄이 나와있는데, 3탄이 스팀에 출시되길 기대해본다.
그리고, 1탄과는 스토리적으로 연관성이 없으므로 2탄을 먼저해도 별 상관이 없다.
히든 오브젝트 게임을 좋아한다면 꼭 해보시길 추천한다.

22457312.review:
As usual for this publisher: lovely music, graphics, and locales. The voice-overs and story coherence were above par, IMO (though it's clear from the beginning who the villain is). The puzzles seemed to get more annoying later in the game, but i'm not really a puzzle person, and that's what the Skip button is for :-D. i found myself needing a Hint on how to continue now and then, unfortunately, but that's my problem, not the game's.

Down-side: other than being short (finished it in under 4 hours), none. There were a few "what the HELL just happened?" moments for me (specifically, the tree with the acorn in its mouth, the arrow stuck in a tree, and collecting the evil snail's slime).

HO scenes: they are overall quite easy, but many of them follow the pattern which is seemingly more common in games from Big Fish: the items collected in such scene combine to build up the item you end up getting after the scene. (i prefer this approach over searching for many random items and keeping one of them afterwards.) Some reviewers complain about the abstract shapes of some of the HO items, but that's clearly a matter of taste. Yes, they DO make the HO scenes more difficult, but that's not necessarily a bad thing. Ambiguous search terms in HO scenes are relatively common (e.g. looking for a "face" when there are at least 3 faces in the scene), but i've seen much worse.

Good pacing, though, combined with nice voices and lovely scenery, make this a nice casual HOPA.

Gotta thumb this up.

Artifex Mundi sp. z o.o. is one of the best Puzzle/Hidden Objects developer I've found so far !

You may think like me that "Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan" can be the sequel of the first game Grim Legends: The Forsaken Bride. But the story is really independent, the only link between them is that each of them relate a grim legend.

The story is very good and graphics are awesome. The puzzles and hidden objects scenes are fairly shared.

The game features an inventory where you can store items to combine with the environment to go deeper in the story. In the game you will also find several animal fellows and one spirit that will help you through your adventure.

The game have several difficulties and have a guest feature : all the family can play the game and resume it where they left. There is also a map which is useful to fast travel through the different places and that can have some hints if you play in an easier mode. Also you can use the Hint/Skip hourglass whenever you want and wait until its refill to use it again. But be warned that you may not skip or use a hint in any puzzle or hidden objects scene if you wish to have some achievements. It's also the case for not skipping the first ten cut scenes while playing the story.

There is a wide choice of puzzles and there are two kind of Hidden objects scenes. The first Hidden objects scene features the name of the objects to find some are found easily (normal one) and some others need you to interact with the environment or to combine two items to found them. The second Hidden objects scene let you find the shape of the objects in the scene and sometimes ask you to use them in order to obtain the others.

(*) :
The game has some achievements that can be missed even some collectibles related achievements and also some challenging achievements including finishing the game on hard mode. There is a guide on steam that will help you to not miss any of these achievements. The challenging achievements require you to finish a puzzle or an hidden objects scene or a domino game under a minute. And two achievements require you to find 3 objects in 3 seconds or find all objects without any misclick in the hidden object scenes.

22157469.review:
Song of the dark swan est l'un des plus ravissants bijoux du catalogue Artifex Mundi, un diamant invité dans un collier de perles. Cette gentille relecture du conte des six cygnes réhausse les sommets de beauté déjà gravis dans les jeux précédents. Son monde de fables, de dragons et de rois a pris forme par un superbe trait de pinceau. On se régale de chacun des tableaux dans lesquels on progresse ; y fouiller des ficelles ou des fleurs nichées dans l'ombre d'un ventre de troll qui se dore le bourrelet au soleil, déjouer les vices des jeux de couleurs et de lumière, ramasser la figurine cachée dans les armoiries d'un bouclier allongé au pied des restes d'un soldat peut-être tombé pour une lointaine bataille, scruter, s'approcher, tripoter les environnements est un plaisir. Un plaisir jamais gêné par des sentiments moins simples, Grim Legends 2 étant situé vers le fond de la moitié basse des jeux d'objets cachés difficiles. On y passe le gros de son temps à résoudre des énigmes et à vaincre les mini-jeux habituels ; eux non plus ne devraient pas vous voler trop de minutes même avec trois grammes de Bordeaux dans le sang.

Song of the dark swan profite de toute l'expérience amassée par les HOG précédents. Partout autour du curseur, le confort moderne. Son interface est claire et élégante, le rythme parfaitement dosé, la narration n'est ni trop discrète ni trop présente, enfin les téléportations d'une zone à l'autre nous simplifient la vie même s'il serait dommage de ne pas lambiner un peu dans de si beaux jardins. Les musiques, assez charmantes pour qu'on les remarque, participent à l'ambiance générale et à ses bienfaits. Un zeste de cruauté coule sur les bosses d'une histoire naïve et tendre, celle des amours interdits et des créatures étranges, d'un élan intrépide mais finalement sans danger qu'on regarde depuis l'autre bout du même prisme féminin que celui à travers lequel on regardait la Caverne de la Rose d'or. 

Plus ambitieux que beaucoup d'autres, pétri de qualités et de raisons de se promener avec sa main dans le chaud de la sienne, Song of the dark swan sera aux habitués ce qu'un psaume est aux fidèles, mais aussi une fenêtre ouverte à l'intention des curieux et des débutants. Au-delà, il risque de semer des coeurs déçus. Le jeu d'objets cachés, encore plus quand il est pensé pour un parterre de novices, est promis à ne jamais dépasser les maîtres du jeu d'aventure ; les pieds enracinés dans des mécanismes redondants, prisonnier d'un public qui se décore le bras de sacs à main, il traîne son corps sur la Terre le menton levé vers en haut, l'oeil rêveur, ambitieux mais incapable de voir ce qu'il y a de l'autre côté du plafond de verre. Toujours malade des mêmes carences, banni du jardin d'Eden, il ne se résigne pourtant pas, ne se satisfait jamais de sa condition. Alors il travaille, progresse et, s'il n'aura jamais d'ailes, pierre après pierre, il bâtit l'escalier de sa tour de Babel.

L'objet caché atteint enfin sa maturité et, en déposant dans nos mémoires des aventures telles que celles des Grim Legends, il continue de grandir et de mériter de baiser les pieds des plus grands que lui. Malgré ses limites inhérentes à son genre, Song of the dark swan nous laisse entrevoir des choses magnifiques, cultive l'art de nous offrir tellement avec si peu, en exemple d'un voyage vers des destinations de luxe mais en classe hyper économique, à bord d'un vieux coucou à pédales qui survole la frontière russo-turque en période de tensions diplomatiques. À l'intérieur, tout le monde se bouscule, se frappe, et vas-y que je te mette un coup de boule, pas de pitié pour les vieilles et les enfants, pour s'asseoir au plus près du hublot. Car de l'autre côté, mille merveilles.

相変わらずエンディングは後味が悪いような雲行きの怪しい感じなのと、ボーナスチャプターですら哀愁漂う物語なので、文字通り鬱蒼とした"Grim Legends"を読みたい体験したいなら、前作より本作の方が完成度は高く、おすすめ出来る

実は個人的にはArtifex Mundiの作品の中では一番面白かった作品のようにも思える
テストプレイ・デバッグがしっかりしてるのか、他のシリーズものより随分丁寧に作られているように見えたし
ゲーム内容のボリュームのほども適度で値段とぴったり折り合い付けれてる
世界観と見事にマッチするかような音楽も好印象で心地良く聞けた
定番の実績やお約束のアイテム組み合わせも理不尽さが殆ど無い為、やりがいも一番あったようにも思えた
正直言って他のアドベンチャーで代用できると言えば代用できる楽しさではあるが、完成度だけで言えば非の付け所が無い
あたりさわりなく楽しめる事だけは[b]間違いなく[/b]保証できるので、猶更におすすめしたい

21876887.review:
[i]Grim Legends[/i] has easily become one of my favorite Artifex Mundi series, with a theme centering around Brothers Grimm Fairytale collection. Each new game is an original and beautiful interpretation of one of their collected European fairytales. Thus, there is no story consistency between games in the series. You can pick and enjoy them as stand-alones. Being a lovely interpretation of [i]The Six Swans[/i] story, [i]Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan[/i] is no different.

Here, we take the role of a healer, brought in to the Eagle Kingdom to find a solution to the young and beautiful Queen's unknown ailment. She has never spoken a word for the years that she has passed with her beloved King; not even after the birth of their son. According to Queen Mother - the Peacock Lady - all she ever does is weaving shirts out of nettle without ever resting. As we just start to examine the young Queen, a sinister green smoke breaks into her chamber, engulfing her and the heir. When the smoke is gone, so is the heir. The Peacock Lady steadily accuses the Young Queen with witchcraft - punishable by burning at the stake as the laws of the land dictate. Suspicious of this accusation, the King pleads with us to find a way to prove her innocence. So, our journey towards the Swan Kingdom - the homeland of the Queen - in hopes of finding proof of her innocence begins. We are to learn of an old tragedy, unmask the real villain and break a curse while we are at it.

Maybe not as dramatic or impressive as the first game, [i]Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan[/i] is still a beautiful interpretation of the original tale and a well-made addition to the series. Artworks are trademark Artifex Mundi at this point: vibrant, appealing and picturesque. Character designs themselves are quite fitting for the tale, with thriving animations, mimics and color choices. Voice acting is not spectacular, but still well above average. Whenever I write about one of these HOGs hailing from Artifex Mundi, I feel like working on a paying advertisement; but I swear that's not the case. Their work in these silly casual games is nearly always that good, that's all.

Gameplay though, is a bit sterile in this one compared to other Artifex Mundi games. We don't have as many HOG scenes as we'd expect. The game is dominated by FROG - Fragmented Object Games - where you are expected to collect pieces of a certain item to make a whole, then use as a part of another item combination. Puzzles are fine - nothing shallow or suicidal, just the right amount of brain scratching, if not a bit basic. Compared to other titles, there is a fair amount of backtracking too, so be ready to recall details from past environments if you are playing in expert difficulty. There is domino or mahjong alternative gameplay here, since there isn't much HOG scenes to alternate between anyhow so one playthrough would be suffice for collecting all achievements.

By the end, this second instalment in the series, is a beautiful game appropriate for a lazy midweek afternoon. Grab it on sale and admire some beautiful artwork accompanied by a neat selection of puzzles and an enchanting retelling of a Grimm Brothers story.

Please also check out Lady Storyteller's Curator page [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/ladystoryteller#curation]here[/url] - follow for regular updates on reviews for other games!

21669092.review:
[b]Spielwertung:[/b] 8/10

[b]Spieldauer:[/b] ca. 5 Stunden inkl. Bonuskapitel (Schwierigkeitsgrad: Experte)

+ schöne Grafik
+ gute Musik und Soundeffekte
+ gute aber leicht düstere Geschichte
+ leicht erreichbare Errungenschaften; im ersten Durchgang 100 % möglich
+ Bonuskapitel (ca. 1 Stunde)
+ sehr belebt wirkende Szenen, durch huschende Insekten, fliegende Blätter etc. 
+ Schnellreisefunktion per Karte
+ Sammelkarten

- Textbalken im oberen Bereich sind sehr groß
- kleinere Text- u. Übersetzungsfehler

[b]Zusammenfassung/Kommentar: [/b]

Nach dem ich Grim Legends: The Forsaken Bride gespielt habe, musste ich unbedingt den zweiten Teil spielen. Ich muss gestehen, dass ich nicht erwartet habe, dass er den ersten Teil übertrifft. Tatsächlich bin ich ein wenig zwiegespalten. Ich fand die Geschichte hier besser aber das Gameplay, besonders wenn ich mir die Wimmelbilder anschaue, schlechter. 

Grafisch braucht sich das Spiel nicht hinter seinem Vorgänger zu verstecken. Auch wenn die Hintergründe etwas anders gezeichnet sind. Sie wirken etwas weniger märchenhaft-mystisch sind aber dennoch sehr schön anzusehen. 
Was mir besonders positiv aufgefallen ist, dass die Szenen belebt wirken. Einerseits sorgen die Hintergrundgeräusche dafür und andererseits huscht immer mal etwas durchs Bild. Eine kleine Libelle, die hin und her fliegt, Blätter, die vom Wind davon geweht werden. (Das passiert auch in den Wimmelbildszenen, wo es vielleicht, als störend empfunden werden könnte.)

Die Geschichte wurde angelehnt an „Die sieben Raben“ von den Gebrüdern Grimm. Sie ähnelt dabei aber mehr einer verfilmten Variante von 1993 und weniger dem Originalmärchen. 
Ich betone aber angelehnt; das Spiel bringt durchaus noch eigene Ideen mit. Inzwischen habe ich schon einige Wimmelbildspiele gespielt. Viele von ihnen haben versucht mich zu berühren, zu gruseln, erschrecken. Und das auf mannigfaltige Art und Weise und nur den Wenigsten ist es gelungen. 
Grim Legends 2 hat es geschafft. Schließlich saß ich vorm Bildschirm: „Was macht das Spiel mit mir? Das ist doch nur ein Wimmelbildspiel!“
Ohne viel spoilern zu wollen: In dem Spiel sterben ein paar Nebenfiguren. Und obwohl man diese nicht gekannt hat, hat es mich berührt. Immerhin haben sie teilweise versucht uns zu beschützen. 

Ich habe in meiner Einleitung gesagt, dass mir die Wimmelbilder nicht so gut gefallen haben. Warum das? Ganz einfach ich mag die Art der Wimmelbilder, die zu einem Großteil verwendet wurden, nicht. Positiv zu erwähnen ist aber, dass man nur zwei bis drei Wimmelbilder doppelt absucht. Ganz wenige Wimmelbilder sind nach dem herkömmlichen Prinzip, dass man ein Wort hat und dann den Gegenstand sucht. Bei vielen sind die Umrisse der gesuchten Gegenstände angezeigt und andere sind nach dem Prinzip: „Suche X-mal Gegendstand X“ (Beispiel: 10x Kräuter suchen)
Gut gemachte Wimmelbilder dieser Art können schwieriger sein, als die Gängigen (so empfinde ich das jedenfalls). Aber häufig waren diese nicht herausfordernder. Schnell der Reihe nach alles Verdächtige angeklickt und man lag meist richtig. Gelegentlich galt es noch etwas zu verschieben. Errungenschaft: „Eine Wimmelbildszene in weniger als 30 Sekunden lösen“ war keine Herausforderung mehr. Mit der Zeit wurde das etwas öde. Gelegentlich reagierten gesuchte Gegenstände etwas behäbig. In einer Szene musste ich fast 4 Mal auf ein Zahnrad klicken, bis sich etwas tat.  
Für ein Wimmelbildspiel gibt es auch „relativ“ wenig Wimmelbildszenen (WBS: 17; Rätsel: 23). 

Die Rätsel waren alle gut lösbar. Mal hin und wieder eins das schwieriger war. Aber es sollten keine wirklich schwierigen dabei sein. Wie immer bei Artifex-Mundi-Spielen einige der Rätsel kommen einen bekannt vor. Es wurden neuere eingeführt, allerdings wurden diese auch in anderen neuen Spielen von AM eingeführt, sodass sie einen wieder bekannt vorkommen. 

Und wieder haben mich die Textbalken gestört. Sie sind sehr groß und verdecken damit einen Teil des oberen Bereichs. Beim absuchen von Szenen leicht störend. 

Dennoch ist Grim Legends 2 ein tolles Spiel. Es hat kleinere Macken, aber die kann man verkraften, da es so einiges richtig macht.  

[b][i]Fazit:[/i][/b] Grim Legends: Song of the Dark Swan ist ein gutes Wimmelbildspiel mit einer guten Geschichte und schönen Bildern. Auch wenn es ein klein wenig schwächer ist, wie der Erste Teil, lohnt sich ein Kauf. Vorkenntnisse vom ersten Teil werden nicht benötigt.

21137025.review:
I have played quite few HOGs and Artifex Mundi is still one of the best HOG developers. They can make any basic story sound interesting with good storytelling, having few plot twists, good puzzles and with really amazing background art. The pros of their games is making the most simple stories interesting and memorable but always having a high quality in their games. The cons are that these games are like Undertale; you get the most fun and delight when you don't know anything about it. Later on it's nice to replay it few times but it doesn't have the same charm anymore. But this game has something that just makes it better when you replay it few times. I played this game twice and the story made lots of more sense. 
This game isn't sequel to earlier Grim Legends-game, the Forsaken bride; it's just an another tale and another story in distant country far away. 
The story is quite decent for HOG game; something bad happens and player has to solve the problem and also seek the truth which lead to horrific events. Basic day. But Artifex Mundi gives live to this story with intriguing backstory which in my opinion sounded realistic. 
The puzzles are not hard but they might take time depending, how accustomed HOG player you're. 
The voice acting is good too, quite good for HOG game. The voices have personality and I have to admit that I still remember clearly the nasal voice of the Peacock queen [spoiler]and the rough and hoarse voice of the Swan king[/spoiler]. 
The art has personality and looks nicely rough and the background looks slightly twisted in my opinion, contrast to the bright colors and prettiness. It makes the game more memorable but also gives the feeling that the world is alive and breathing when our protagonist is on the adventure.The music also is really pretty but not something that really stays in mind.
There's a main game but also a bonus game but the main games story is much more well thought than the bonus. It just gave me the feeling that Artifex Mundi had to add some kind of bonus story so the CE wouldn't feel waste for the buyers. But it is still enjoyable if you don't think it too much. [spoiler]And personally I would have liked to that bonus was small prequel or sequel of the main story than another story in Swan queens perspective.[/spoiler]   

It's good game with basic story where you solve the mystery of mysterious events. It's one of the best Artifex Mundi games they have made for awhile and for it's high quality in art, story and possible the collectibles you can say that you haven't wasted you money in vain. If you're still thinking should you buy this use your extra money to it when you wan't to just sit down and have fun or buy it when it's on sale. This game is a good introduction on the Hidden object genre and on the Artifex Mundi games.

The pros: 
- gorgeous art
- basic story with an twist 
- memorable voice acting 
- realistic characters      
- replay possibility

The cons: 
- needs more than one play through to enjoy properly 
- slightly linear story 
- predictable

20329661.review:
Неплохая и очень красивая игра с непривычно жестокой и мрачной историей - это первый раз, пожалуй, когда я что-то подобное в играх Artifex Mundi вижу, и сюрприз не самый приятный. Но если закрыть на это глаза, Песня черного лебедя вполне соответствует привычному качеству разработчиков: красивейшая графика, отличные ролики, интересные загадки и мини-игры, очень милое бонусное приключение (тот случай, когда оно понравилось больше основной игры - очень уж славный магический народец у разработчиков получился). 
Если сравнивать с предыдущей игрой той же серии (общего у них только название, сюжетно истории никак не связаны), то она мне понравилась больше: сюжет был куда более закрученным (здесь главного злодея угадываешь практически сразу, и мотивы там весьма странные), сама игра длиннее, и как-то ощущалась позитивнее - я всё-таки считаю, что настолько мрачная и кровавая история плохо подходит для расслабляющей казуалки. Так что если вы ещё не играли в первую часть - лучше восполните пробел и оставьте Песню черного лебедя на потом. В другом случае, игру можно и приобрести для коллекции - всё-таки по качеству контента она одна из самых сильных у Artifex Mundi.

20316859.review:
Ну, если игре требуется мой отзыв, то я его напишу.
По моему - это такой нихеровый пример того, каким должен быть квест.
История очень занятная и вполне необычная, я всегда поражался тем сюжетам, что пишут эти игроделы.
Очень приятное музыкальное сопровождение.
Эти дуратские сцены с поисками предметов ограничены, их считай нет. Я не любитель таких типа "нади башмак" это глупо, ты даже не понимаешь куда деваются эти предметы. Тут же в большинстве случаев надо собирать предмет из осколков, вполне логично и просто. Во многих квестах ты порой встаешь в тупик, потому что тупо не улавливаешь, что и куда, так как впринципе нихрена не понятно, к счастью тут такого тоже нет, все вполне плавно и спокойно,нет огромной карты, вместо этого все поделено на зоны, что облегчает процесс. [i]Song of the Dark Swan[/i] is a particularly well-done HOG.  It offers a nice mix of different types of HO scenes, hunting for plot coupons, and minigames of easy-to-middling difficulty.  It riffs broadly on the elements of [i]The Six Swans[/i] from the Brothers Grimm, but changes things up enough to keep the tale fresh.  

This would be an excellent introduction to the HO genre for beginners.  For those already familiar with the tropes of HO games, I recommend playing on Expert, as this, like all Artifex Mundi games I've encountered, leans towards the easy end of the spectrum.

19171248.review:
[h1]Summary[/h1]
Decent HOG and puzzle game with a middling story and good mechanics. Good for a few hours of fun if you enjoy the genre. 

[h1]Review[/h1]
You play as the Healer, summoned to the Eagle Kingdom by the Eagle King to cure his nameless mute wife, the mother of his nameless son. Nameless sinister forces are at work however and make your task a great deal harder as the son is kidnapped, the wife accused of magic use (illegal by the decree of the otherwise nameless Peacock Queen, the Eagle King’s mother). Overall I found the story pretty bland and not as enjoyable as Grim Legends: The Forsaken Bride. There is very few twists and for the most part it is just good vs evil. The voice acting is mostly poor and the “characters” are incredibly one-dimensional – in case you had missed it, not a single person in the game even has a name. Hell, the wife’s nickname from one of her forest friends is “little P” for little princess. Lazy.

Still, the game looks good and mechanically it is fine. Nothing really inventive or super challenging, but decent variety of HOGS and puzzles. So I would say it is good for a few hours of relaxing HOGing (I finished both the main story and the extra chapter in about 6.6 hours on Expert difficulty and with all achievements), but if you are looking for a challenge, inventive puzzles or a compelling story… look elsewhere.

这是通关的第18个steam游戏了，距离前作通关已经快一年了。
剧情跟前代毫无关系，应该是根据安徒生童话“野天鹅”改编的（这么说，前作说不定也是哪个童话改编的）。讲述作为医生的女主（又是女的）应邀给王后看病，结果呢因为种种原因王后被太后揭发说是巫婆，要处死。然后王后因为要织荨麻又不能说话，然后国王拜托女主去查清原因。查来查去，就是王后的兄弟被太后施法变成了天鹅，只有穿上荨麻衣服才能变回人形，然后还有一只黑天鹅，是昏了头的大哥，去跟了太后。最后当然是揭开阴谋，大团圆结局。

18869739.review:
[b]Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan[/b] is a casual point and click adventure game set in a fantasy/fairy tale world. For adventure gamers who aren't particularly fond of hidden object scenes, I have pleasant news, as hidden object scenes in Grim Legends 2 occur very occasionally. The bulk of the gameplay consists of exploration, inventory-based puzzles, and a large variety of puzzle mini-games, and I found myself being constantly impressed by how refreshing the mini-game selection was. I play a LOT of point and click adventure games (or HOPAs) and consider myself to be very picky within this genre, however, I never felt like I had a dull moment exploring the beautiful and immersive world of Grim Legends 2. The storyline is a bit cheesy, but that's OK, as some characters were memorable and lovable, and the artwork and music was of a very high-quality. I think what stood out most to me in this game was how beautiful the scenery was.

Keep in mind that this is a Collector's Edition (this fact isn't mentioned on the Steam store page). This means that aside from the main game/story, there's also a (much smaller) bonus game/story, as well as goodies to include wallpapers, concept art and re-playable hidden object mini-games. The main game as well as the bonus game took me about 4 hours to complete on Expert mode, so you can expect a similar amount of gameplay hours if you're familiar with point and click games.

[b]TLDR: Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan is a well-made point and click adventure game, with a variety of enjoyable puzzles, lovely artwork and music, adequate voice acting, and a storyline that isn't too remarkable.[/b] I would recommend it (on sale) to anyone who enjoys point and click adventure games, particularly those who enjoy fantasy settings. It's an excellent game for young children who have demonstrated interest in fairy tales, too.

18689206.review:
[u]Pros:[/u]
- Descent music, sounds and voices
- Graphics are fine
- Some puzzles are a bit more original than usual
- I always enjoy the theatre-like puzzles
- Uses the modern interface/system of the more recent games from this company

[u]Cons:[/u]
- Animations are sometimes weird, as in all their other games, since they are based more on blending and morphing pictures than different frames. However, it's quite well done for this type of animation.
- Several hidden objects scenes have objects with arbitrary shapes that look like nothing you're familiar with and that makes them artificially hard to find.
- Not enough hidden objects scenes for this type of game.
- The maze section relies on clues that are not clear: I finished the game 3 times and I'm still not sure I understood the logic.
- A few puzzles are illogical (more than the average for this kind of game). [spoiler]For instance, using the saliva of the "snail" to glue the eagle figurine. Firstly, using saliva to glue stone makes no sense. Secondly, you have to put the piece on the saliva directly, while the game got you used to collect liquids in recipients before using them.[/spoiler]
- There's also one instance where you have to backtrack way too much just to get one object that was hard to notice in the first place. [spoiler]You have to get out of the Dark Castle to get the arrow for the crossbow.[/spoiler]
- Lastly, and that's disapointing for this type of game, I didn't like the story: it made no sense to me, probably because it was badly told.

[u]Conclusion:[/u]
While it's not a terrible game, it is one of the worst HO games from Artifex Mundi.
I didn't enjoy it as much as their other titles. I'd recommend playing those instead, unless you've finished them all already.

18352015.review:
Druhy dil pohadkove serie hidden object adventur od Artifexu. Opet autori vyuzili motivu z pohadek bratri Grimmu. Tentokrat se ocividne inspirovali bud pohadkou "Sedmero krkavcu" nebo "Sestero labuti". Hra ma sice opet zenskou hrdinku, bylinkarku, ale prisla mi trochu mene cilena na zeny-hracky nez "svatebni" prvni dil, protoze pribeh je neutralnejsi. Hrac ma za ukol vysetrit a vylecit nemou kralovnu Labutiho kralovstvi, coz se hned zahy zvrtne.
Co se tyce postupu v pribehu, pouzivani predmetu ci hadanek, z vetsi casti je hrani bezproblemove. Je tu ovsem par puzzlu, ktere dokazou vytocit. Vetsinou jde o nejake posouvani ci zapinani/vypinani cehosi, coz ale zaroven ovlivnuje sousedni jednotky. To dela techto par miniher dost tezkymi. Na jednu stranu je to plus, protoze uplne lehkou adventuru nemusim, ale na druhou je u nich tezke prijit na logiku ci spravny postup a jsou spis otravnou zalezitosti typu pokus-omyl. Takze je muzete nahodou vyresit za minutu, ale taky na ne klikat ctvrt hodiny bez vysledku :) 
V pribehu se k vam obcas pripoji nejaky ten pomocnik, podobne jako kote v jednicce, ale tady jich je nekolik - vlastovka, vydra, lesni duch.
Grafika je opet kvalitne nakreslena, jako z pohadkovych knizek (takova "stetcova" poctiva malba), ale trochu mi ve screenech chybel pocit hloubky. Vetsina hernich obrazovek totiz pusobi jaksi "plose". Zvuk ci hudba me nijak neohromily, ale tak aspon nejsou otravne.
Nejvetsim plusem teto serie je, ze se jedna o samostatne kousky, nijak na sebe nenavazujici. Spolecne maji jen pohadkove motivy. "Dark Swan" ma navic proti jednicce plus v tom, ze nemusite hru kvuli 100% achievementum dohravat dvakrat (huraaa, zadne domino hry). Ale zase ma par vyse zminenych nedostatku, takze hodnotim stejne.
V CE edici mate opet wallpapery, OST, artworky a bonusovou kapitolu, ktera se sklada ze dvou kratickych pribehu, tykajicich se lesnich duchu. Pokud chcete hru cesky, stahujte z [url=http://www.alawarhry.cz/game/grim-legends-song-of-the-dark-swan-collectors-edition/]Alawaru[/url].
[na zaver dulezita rada pro nalezeni 100% lecivych znaku - u vetsiny obrazovek sviti u spodniho okraje lahvicka, pokud je znak na screenu pritomen; ovsem na stene veze, za kterou najdete kralovnu, tento indikator nic nedela - zrejme bug - a tudiz byste znak ani nehledali; takze pozor na to, je zeleny, mezi brectanem]

[h1]70%[/h1]

Once again Artifex Mundi has handed us a really good hidden object game. They make these well folks, always. 

This time you get to play in a 1700ty/1800ty ish fantasy playground. Fight Dark sorcery with herbal spells and your ability to find those lost bits. 

Do you know the Dark Swan myth? Then you understand the plot. Ever want to play a part within a old myth? Here you get to. That's the joy of this series. There are a few twists and those are the fun surprises.

This isn't part 2 of the story of Grim Legends 1, it's a second grim legend. If they ever make a third one I can easily imagine it will be yet a another different legend.

Pros
Nice music. 
Well use of voice acting.
It's pretty. Just plain outright pretty to look at and watch.
Middle level gameplay. Spend a few mins and you'll rarely have to use the hint button.

Cons (of a sort)
Lack of gameplay inovation. It's just like nearly every other well made hidden object game. This isn't a bad thing but it's almost as if they used a formula.
Not really a mystery, if you rember the myth. 


This is a really well made hidden object game. Definatly worth buying and adding to your collection.

17905817.review:
Another day, another Hidden Object Game. This time around it's Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan. I'm going to go ahead and say that this is easily the best HOG I've played yet. Admittedly, it doesn't sound like much since this is also only the fourth one I've played, but all the same. With its combination of spectacular art, great music, a solid story, and quality puzzles, I can't think of a reason for genre fans to avoid this title.

The plot starts off simple enough. You're a herbalist of some fame, and a king rolls out the red carpet, in the hopes that you can cure his queen's ailment. The queen can't speak and...eh well the rest is on you to figure out. There's a mystery to solve, a handful of twists and turns, and you're going to figure it all out and save the day. However, if you fail then...that would be silly! This is a HOG after all, the answer is always one click away. How you proceed is up to you. Skip through all of the puzzles to focus on the story? Or take your time and get your money's worth? 

For those unfamiliar with the genre, a good Hidden Object Game is more than just finding trinkets. HOGs should also offer numerous puzzles, a compelling plot, and quality presentation. Like most adventure games, a HOG doesn't have much in the way of replay-value, so it's massively important that the few hours of game-play it offers are memorable. Grim Legends 2 is very successful in this regard. The art-direction employs some great usage of colors, and despite lacking 4k or even 2k resolution, can still astonish with its well-drawn environments. For the most part, the hidden object portions of this game are designed intelligently. The pieces are creatively hidden, and are sometimes unique, such as pieces of an elaborate necklace, or the parts of a magnifying glass. The difficulty is also well-balanced, so you'll feel that at least some effort is necessary. This makes progressing through the adventure more fulfilling.

As far as nitpicks go (don't act so surprised!) the NPCs can look rather strange. It's hard to describe. They have this uncanny valley when they speak to you. Perhaps that isn't the right term for it, but it certainly looks unnatural. Aside from being a blemish on the otherwise fantastic art-direction, weirdo NPC faces isn't a big deal. The herbalist's voice-acting is a little suspect at times, but again...nothing major. Everyone else in the game picks up the slack quite nicely.

All in all this is a great title to look into whether you're already fans of the genre, or a newcomer looking for a worthwhile entry point.

17407651.review:
"Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan" is a tough one to rate.  On one hand, Artifex Mundi (AM) has improved their Achievements so they aren't mutually exclusive.  In other words, we're not forced to make two run throughs to get all Achievements (yay!).  Also, the graphics seem to be a bit sharper and brighter than earlier games.  On the other hand, the voice acting is much worse than normal.  Some of the voice acting is on par with other AM games (i.e., tolerable).  But, the queen's voice acting is bad and the various children's voice acting is utterly horrible.  I cringed every time I had to click on those kids and listen to their "acting."  Ugh.  To go along with the bad voice acting, the story is even worse than usual for these casual adventure Hidden Object games (HOGs).  So, instead of an OK-cutesy story, this one tends towards the OK-silly side.  If it weren't for the dead bodies lying around, I'd even lean towards it being written for kids (especially in the Bonus Chapter).  I'd also like to mention that even though this game is classified as a HOG, most of the puzzles are NOT technically HOGs:  they're FROGs (Fragmented/Fractured Object Game).  Plus, most of the HOGs are of the type where you have to find a bunch of fairies or a bunch of flowers and not of the type where you have a hodgepodge of various items hidden among other miscellany.  Of course, that could be good or bad, depending on your tastes.

Unfortunately, I didn't properly record my actual game play time.  So, I can't give the exact duration of the game.  But, it took me about 8 hours to finish the whole thing with 100% Achievements:  a little over 6 hours for the main game and 1.7 hours for the Bonus Chapter.  So, with the pluses and minuses noted above, coupled with the slightly short game play, I'm recommending the game.  But, only if you can find it on sale.  I'd say you should buy it if you can find it for less than six dollars.

17176152.review:
Artifex Mundi is a name that I associate with good quality games. I enjoyed the previous "Grim Legends", so I was really looking forward to this one.

[h1]Like[/h1]

[b]Graphics[/b]
The game has wonderful artwork. Very detailed and colorful. 

[b]Puzzles[/b]

There's a good variety of them and they are all fairly easy to solve. A tip for someone else: When you need to guide the princess wood piece across the map... don't drag the piece. Just click where you want her to go. I wish I knew that before raging because the piece kept jumping around and breaking the puzzle.

The hidden object scenes dosen't overload every scene with thousand of objects. All objects are clear and in a realistic size for the environment they are in. Everything is easy to find once you know what you are looking for. There were perhaps 2-3 objects which were a bit colorless that took a harder time to find.

[b]Story[/b]
It was unusually grim for a Artifex Mundi game. But I like that, it added suspence to the story and even if you didn't get to know the characters too well, you still felt very sorry for them. It deals with a lot of emotions of even the background characters, such as guilt, regret, pain and grief. 

[h1]Dislike[/h1]

[b]Voice-acting[/b]

It isn't awful (except for the children), but it is the same woman as every other game. Can't they hire someone else? She is okay, but obviously still can't bother to do any form of shouting or screaming in terror. 2 out of 3 times she doesn't even bother, even though it clearly says "Ah!" in the subtitles. 

[b]Main character[/b]

The person you control is only known as "healer" and all she does is make healing brews out of herbs and solve the mystery. I just didn't like her for some reason. Usually I don't care that much about the anonymous main character, but this one was so dense. You figure things out long before she even puts anything together. 17041594.review:
[h1]Short version: 80%[/h1]
Grim Legends 2 is a beautiful fragmented object game set in a fairy tale land. It’s not as memorable as its predecessor, but it can be a great addition to the library of any Artifex Mundi fan.

[h1]Long version:[/h1]
Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan is a sequel in name only. The fairy tale setting remained, but everything else changed– including the sub-genre, which is now fragmented object.

The story is a spin on the Grimm fairy tale ‘The Twelve Brothers’: a heartbroken evil sorceress curses a kingdom, turns the seven sons of the royal family into swans, and their sister mute. You start the game several years later, after said sister married and had a child, whom is promptly kidnapped. Your task is, naturally, to save the infant and break the curse while you’re at it.

The fragmented object (and the few hidden object) scenes all have the usual high Artifex Mundi quality, whereas the conventional puzzles are a bit repetitive. The story uses a rather strange route with a lot of backtracking. This can make life pretty overcomplicated on the highest difficulty, but it can also give the game an unusually long play time for its worth.

16970726.review:
Kolejna część Mrocznych Legend zabierze nas w bajkową krainę, w której zmierzymy się ze złem, nękającym królewski dwór.

[h1]OPRAWA[/h1]
Według mnie jest to jedna z najładniejszych gier Artifexu. Każda lokacja jest wręcz przepełniona kolorami, a idealne dobranie cieni pogłębia atmosferę tej bajkowej krainy. Jak zawsze każda lokacja jest rysowana ręcznie co sprawia, dzięki czemu możemy zobaczyć idealne dopracowanie każdego szczegółu. Możemy również dostrzec wiele kontrastów pomiędzy lokacjami dzięki czemu możemy odczuć różnorodność. Klimat dopełniany jest poprzez wiele różnych dźwięków takich jak szum wody, śpiew ptaków, oraz sporo innych odgłosów przyrody.

[h1]FABUŁA[/h1]
Wcielamy się w uzdrowicielkę, która zostaje wezwana na królewski dwór w sprawie wielu nieszczęść, które nawiedziły  pałac ostatnimi czasy. Od momentu przyjazdu wiadomo, że nie będzie to zwykłe zadanie, a za wszelkimi problemami stoi coś potężnego. Zaczyna się wyścig z czasem, a na szali jest życie królowej. Co prawda opowieść jest trochę przewidywalna jednak to nie oznacza, że nie potrafi nas czasem zaskoczyć. 

[h1]ROZGRYWKA[/h1]
Gra się bardzo przyjemnie, nie doświadczyłem żadnych błędów, a piękna grafika wzmacnia świetne doznania z rozgrywki. W chwili przerwy możemy zająć się poszukiwaniem przedmiotów kolekcjonerskich. Mamy do dyspozycji kilka poziomów trudności dzięki czemu każdy znajdzie coś dla siebie. Dużo łamigłówek oraz scen z ukrytymi obiektami rzuci nam wyzwanie na spostrzegawczość jak i logiczne myślenie.

[h1]PODSUMOWUJĄC[/h1]
Fantastyczna przygoda w bajkowej oprawie graficznej sprawi, że te kilka godzin gry zlecą nam niestety bardzo szybko. Jest to idealna gra dla łowców osiągnięć, gdyż wszystkie wyzwania są dosyć łatwe.

[h1]DLA TYCH, KTÓRZY NIE LUBIĄ CZYTAĆ[/h1]
+ Piękna, ręcznie rysowana grafika
+ Wciągająca historia
+ Przedmioty kolekcjonerskie
+ Łatwe osiągnięcia steam
+ Relaksująca muzyka
+ Bajkowa sceneria
+ Dopracowana w każdym aspekcie
+ Sporo łamigłówek
+ Sceny z ukrytymi obiektami

Jeżeli moja recenzja pomogła Ci przy podjęciu decyzji nad zakupem, będę wdzięczny jeśli ją ocenisz/skomentujesz, co jest dla mnie ogromną motywacją do pracy nad kolejnymi tekstami.

16728631.review:
If you’ve read any of my other reviews for Artifex Mundi developed games, you should know I am a huge fan.  The art, the voice acting, the story, the atmosphere is always on point. 

This is one of their newest releases and it shows! Every time they release a new game the art of the animations gets smoother and more real. Because, let’s face it, there are many HOGs that have great art overall, but when it comes to the animation parts… it’s usually a little wonky.  I’m so happy to say that AM manages to improve with each game they release.

I also really like that the HOG parts of the game itself are not just lists of items you should look for, but also little images of the items you need instead of the words. I’m a fan of the genre, but too many grocery shopping lists in crowded screens gets a little boring sometimes. 

The puzzles in Grim Legends 2 are nothing too hard, though two managed to get me stuck at least 30 minutes each. The difficulty varies from ‘Seeing The Answer Right Away’ to, ‘I’m Just Pressing Random Buttons’ to, ‘I’ll Turn On My Brain Now For Some Serious Thinking’. 

There’s also no need to have played Grim Legends 1 for story purposes, there are achievements all around and you can actually carry the baby. No carrying babies around in inventories, aww yeah.

16241008.review:
Song of the Dark Swan is the second installment of Grim Legends series. Thre previous installment of this series: The Forsaken Bride.


[h1]Review[/h1]

Game Menu Option: Two section – Volume and Miscellaneous settings. The volume section has the following: Music and Sound. The miscellaneous section has the following: Custom Cursor, Voice Overs, Difficulty Mode and Full Screen. Wide Screen is automatically supported in the game.

Game Difficulty Modes: Three game difficulty modes – Casual, Advanced and Expert.

Cinematic/Dialogues: All cinematic scenes can be skipped if you do not want to watch them. Most of the cinematic scenes can be watch over again under the cut scene section the extras. There is an option for skipping the entire dialogue scenes without having sit through it.

Game Voiceovers: Nothing much can be said about the voiceovers asides from that they are well done.

Game Music/Sounds: Nothing much can be said about the music/sounds asides from that they both fit well with the game.

Game Graphics: Nothing much can be said about the graphics asides from that they are nicely drawn with a painted feel to them.

Inventory Panel: There is a lock option for the inventory panel. Easy access for the items that are collected in the game.

Notebook: Objectives only.

Map: The map interactive with useful indicators; map icons/markers. The legend on the map explains the function for each of the map icons. The ability to fast travel to another location and back. The map can be access two-way via through the notebook or map scrolls next to the notebook.

Hidden Object Gameplay: Find “X” Amount, Fragmented items, Shadow items, Traditional word list with some and/or no interaction required. The hidden object scenes can be replayed in the hidden object puzzle section in the extras.

Puzzle Gameplay: Most of the puzzles are fairly easy to solve. There is a skip button if the puzzle(s) becomes too tasking to solve.

Game Helper: Three critter helpers can carry out certain tasks that the players can’t complete themselves. Like retrieving items that are out of reach.

Game Ending: There is an ending for the main portion of the game. The bonus chapter portion of game is the pre-sequel to the main portion of the game.

Game Achievements: In game and Steam. Most of these achievements are featured in Steam’s achievement. There are three different sets of achievements to earn. Gameplay: 11; Collectables: 31; Story: 18. In total there are 29 achievements altogether.

Game Collectables: There are 31 Healer Sigils to collect within the game. They are scattered throughout the game.

Game Concept Art/Wallpapers: 12 concept art and 10 wallpapers.

Game Trading Card/Badge: This a special feature only available in the Steam’s version of the game. The game drops three different trading cards only once and the rest of the cards: Community Market, Booster Packs and Trading. The game badge can be crafted after having all the card in the inventory then it can be upgraded four more times.

Whilst not as good as Grim Legends, it's still a solid entry in this genre. Again, you play a female protagonist (this time the unnamed healer) as you amble through a retelling of a fairy tale, although given the choice of fairy tale this renders certain elements of the tale quite nonsensical. 

Compared to the others by this developer I found this one relied a little too often on obscuring items with immovable objects which made them awkward to spot, but none of the puzzles, hidden object or otherwise, are too hard. The bonus chapter is set before the story but has no real relationship to it. I've gotta say I barely noticed the soundscapes, and where Grim Legends had a cute kitten, it felt like they'd tried to improve on that by offering you a variety of helpers throughout the game, but with such a short game and such infrequent use of the various companions it was hard to be too attached. Still they were all cute and the game is just fine. I suspect the it was the mangling of one of my favourite childhood tales that irked me slightly with this one.

Oh and the pronunciation of "ginormous."

16132289.review:
[H1] VERSION COURTE [/H1]

[i]Grim Legend II[/i] est un [i]d'objets cachés[/i] assez basique dans on genre, et pourtant il a tant à offrir. Vous incarnez une personne dotée de pouvoirs de guérison. Vous êtes appelé auprès de la reine du pays pour la soigner. Cependant, un mal profond gronde dans les terres, et l'enfant de la reine finit par être kidnappée. C'est à ce moment mélodramatique que commence votre aventure ... et je dois bien avouer que ça a de la gueule. Les graphismes sont plutôt chouette, la bande son très dynamique tout en étant relaxante, et l'histoire est très intéressante. Malheureusement le jeu m'a quelque peu ... déçu. Le jeu suit une courbe de difficulté ascendante et le début vous offre une suite logique d'objets et d'actions, et même sans vraiment savoir ce qu'il y a faire, vous le devinez, tout de même, assez facilement. Malheureusement, après avoir fait trois quarts du jeu, j'ai eu l'impression que le jeu abandonnait toute la logique de progression ... logique que j'avais énormément appréciée, puisqu'elle permet de suivre l'histoire tranquillement. Mais la fin ... complètement perdu. On ramasse des objets, et on ne sait pas quoi en faire, c'est aussi simple que ça. Toutefois, je recommande le jeu pour son histoire et son ambiance à toutes personnes souhaitant suivre une histoire tranquillement, sans se prendre la tête.

Artifex Mundi delivers again!

While the plot is a bit obvious, mainly if you've read the fairytale before, it's still kept interesting. The artwork is amazing and it's reallly fun to have different animal helpers. The hidden object scenes are typically not your, "here's a list of items to find" but usually find multiple of one type of item in a scene or find all the items pictured below. There are a few typical object scenes but the mixture keeps it fresh and won't leave you randomly clicking by end game. The puzzles are inventive and while a lot are repeated from other games, they've been adjusted for this game's setting and feel new. The voice acting could be better but I think the Princess' was the best... (She's mute btw).

The story is a bit short, it took me a little over 2 hours to beat but the additional bonus story adds another good hour. If you want to travel to a different land and experience high quality point and click game play, this game is perfect.

9.5/10

15754742.review:
Шикарный ( как всегда ) квест от Artifex-ов. Достаточно заниженная сложность на фоне ранних проектов, не такое большое количество пазлов, новых их типов не найдено, и почти нет поиска предметов на локации по их названиям (их заменили сценки с поиском частей разрушенных предметов и комбинацией предметов представленных на сцене для осуществления каких-либо действий).
Единственный, но большой недостаток - кривая на данный момент руссификация проекта. Присутствуют предложения являющиеся простым набором слов не имеющих в своей связке никакого русского значения. Постоянно путается пол песонажей - девочку называют мальчиком, мальчиков - девочками. Хотя возможно в толлерантной Европе так и задумано. 
Но когда выдру постоянно называют феей, а фею временами выдрой - это звучит как минимум феерично.
На момент прохождения одна задача была запорота кривым переводом - когда смешиваем одно из зелий нам предлагают загадку на последовательность укладывания туда инградиентов, которую придется решать методом научного тыка, поскольку подсказка в одном из пунктов путает слова "за" и "перед".
Первый квест Артифексов в котором у нас будет целых три разных помощника подряд, и где экстра-миссия мне понравилась на уровне основной сюжетки.
