Song of the Dark Swan ist der zweite Teil der Grim Legends Wimmelbild-Reihe von Artifex Mundi. Wie Teil 1 "The forsaken Bride" ist es ein Spiel, das sehr an ein Märchen erinnert und auch so aufgebaut ist. Es beginnt zwar nicht mit "Es war einmal", aber der Verlauf der Geschichte ist gleich dem einem Märchen - Apropo Geschichte, diese ist gut, stimmig und ohne Logikfehler. Überraschende Wendungen enthält sie schon, auch wenn man direkt zu Beginn erahnen kann, wer der Böse ist. 
Grafik, Atmosphäre und Soundtrack waren dabei wie immer klasse und langweilten nicht. Die Minispiele sind abwechslungsreich und die Wimmelbilder enthielten keine Fehlbezeichnungen von Obejkten. Alles in allem war ein guter Anspruch bei den Rätseln gegeben.
Daher kann ich Grim Legends 2 Song of theDark Swan ohne Bedenken jedem Wimmelbild / Hidden-Object Fan an's Herz legen, es ist bisher einer der besten Teile von Artifex Mundi.

15234066.review:
On its own, this is a good hidden object game. Puzzles are detailed and beautiful, the storyline is well worked out and, while lifting on a well-known fairytale, still has twists.
All screens are partially animated, making the world feel alive, and the cinematic scenes are the developer's best work yet.

Compared to its predecessor however, Grim Legends 2 disappoints a little. Voice acting is of a lesser quality, with even cases where the subtitles and voice dialogue don't match.
Gameplay wise, there is only one kind of optional collectable to the previous games' two kinds, and you can no longer opt out of a hidden object puzzle for another kind of game: you now only have the option to use the hint button instead.

Fortunately both have standalone stories, so you won't necessarily need to buy "2" for story reasons.

Good is that the companion idea from the previous game returns, with now not just one critter helping you, but a new one per chapter. They are also used more, and feel more relevant to the story.
There is also more variation in the puzzles this time than just combine A with B or slide puzzles, so there is less idea of repetition here. You also backtrack less than in Grim Legends 1.

Overall Grim Legends 2 is a polished game well worth playing, but I feel more could have been done with it to make it a proper sequel to the first game. Taking it as a standalone though, I can definitely recommend it.

Artifex Mundi has come a long way and their Hidden Object games keep getting better and better. Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan is definitely no exception.

While the second installment of the Grim Legends series it is not a sequel and this game can be played and enjoyed without knowledge of the former. Though I do recommend [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/284850]that one[/url] as well as it is very good.

This game is rich and colorful, comes with a handy fast travel map and all the usual things you'd expect in a Hidden Object game. While in Grim Legends 1 you'd only get help from a single pet [i](a very cute kitty!)[/i] this time around there are three (!) different pets that will accompany you throughout your travels and aid you when they can.

Nice variation in puzzles, beautiful locations, good story, fun pets, and improved voice acting (albeit still poor at times).

Encountered no bugs or broken achievements.
An Expert Mode run-through is required to get 100%.

[b]9/10[/b]

15099640.review:
I was really impressed by this game. It has a real intense story, with even some twists, while at the same time providing a lot of mini games and puzzles. The puzzels mostly fit nicely into the story, which is quite seldom the case. The minigames are varying quite nicely. Beside of some of the hidden object minigames, none is the same as another (sometimes there is more than one of the same time in a sequence). Even the hidden object minigames are varying, which is really great.

But the element that really keeps one to continue this game is how everything is driven by the story.  The story is provided with small cutscenes and short dialoges. But also by some of the minigames or other things one just discoveres. All those scenes are short enough, so that I never was tempted to skip them. (You get an archivement for not skipping the first ones.)

Last but not least I liked both the graphic and the music. Both added to the atmosphere of the game.

15092704.review:
Czarny Łabędź to moja 13-ta gra od Artifex Mundi ukończona, tak jak pozostałe, na 100% i stawiam ją na równi z Pieśnią Syreny, która do tej pory była według mnie najlepszą grą AM dostępną na steam. Wizualnie gra wypada bardzo dobrze - lokacje sprawiają wrażenie ręcznie rysowanych w bajkowej kolorystyce. W pierwszej części Grim legends towarzyszyło nam jedno zwierzątko - tutaj jest ich cała trójka istotek z czego ta ostatnia wydaje mi się najsympatyczniejszą z wszystkich pojawiających się w grach AM. Poziom trudności gry i długość rozgrywki jest standardowy dla większości gier AM. Czarny Łabędź ma zdecydowanie mniej standardowych(szukania przedmiotów po ich napisach - a te dostępne są bardzo proste) gier w ukryte przedmioty niż inne pozycje tej firmy. Przeważają tutaj wyszukiwania określonej ilości tych samych przedmiotów na jednym obrazku. W GL2 nie ma gry wymiennej dla poszukiwania ukrytych przedmiotów. Poszukujemy również pieczęci w lokacjach posiłkując się niczym radarem, jak w pierwszym Grim Legends, wskazaniami interfejsu.

15068571.review:
Just when I thought it would never happen, just when I had given up hope, just when I had realized I would be aimlessly banging rocks together for the rest of my puzzle-gaming career, I combined flint and steel to make a fire.

Also there was a nifty puzzle game and stuff.

This is no mere clone of the first game. The tone is darker, with much more death; there's no single cute helper; the familiar "find the object OR play the game" is swapped out for smaller hunts. The music isn't quite as atmospheric and the sense of mystery and discovery is swapped out for, well, an actual mystery you  have to solve. Having to meet more people and talk to them changes the sense of isolation and exploration from the first game. There's less exploring a new world and more unraveling the past. Is it better? Depends on what you want. 

Also I have to say it: that face in the one hidden object game came off as a little, um. Racist?

15067345.review: Great game, loving the music and challenge of puzzles.  Very relaxing game to play after work.

15065615.review:
Here's a beautiful light point & click adventure game from Artifex Mundi, and it might be their best yet. The game is based on the popular fairy tale "The Wild Swans" by Handersen, and features gorgeous backgrounds, beautiful music and an engaging story, as well as excellent voice acting. As a bonus, you'll get companions like a bird, a fairy and a cute otter :3

Even though it's part of the "Grim Legends" series, it works as a stand alone game so you don't really need to play the first one (which is a pleasant game too). 

I definitely recommend it if you're looking for a relaxing, cozy adventure game

8/10
